toc1: The Epistle of Paul to Titus

mt1: The Epistle of Paul to Titus

contents.verseText: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
contents: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the knowledge of the
truth which is according to godliness,

contents.verseText: in hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before times eternal;
contents: in hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before times eternal;

contents.verseText: but in his own seasons manifested his word in the message, wherewith I was intrusted according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
contents: but in his own seasons manifested his word in the message, wherewith I was intrusted according to the commandment of God
our Saviour;

contents.verseText: to Titus, my true child after a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
contents: to Titus, my true child after a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

contents.verseText: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that were wanting, and appoint elders in every city, as I gave thee charge;
contents: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that were wanting, and appoint elders in
every city, as I gave thee charge;

contents.verseText: if any man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children that believe, who are not accused of riot or unruly.
contents: if any man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children that believe, who are not accused of riot or unruly.

contents.verseText: For the bishop must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-willed, not soon angry, no brawler, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre;
contents: For the bishop must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-willed, not soon angry, no brawler, no striker, not greedy of
filthy lucre;

contents.verseText: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober-minded, just, holy, self-controlled;
contents: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober-minded, just, holy, self-controlled;

contents.verseText: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able both to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict the gainsayers.
contents: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able both to exhort in the sound doctrine,
and to convict the gainsayers.

contents.verseText: For there are many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision,
contents: For there are many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision,

contents.verseText: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
contents: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s
sake.

contents.verseText: One of themselves, a prophet of their own, said, Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, idle gluttons.
contents: One of themselves, a prophet of their own, said,
Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, idle gluttons.

contents.verseText: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
contents: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

contents.verseText: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
contents: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.

contents.verseText: To the pure all things are pure: but to them that are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
contents: To the pure all things are pure: but to them that are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but both their mind and
their conscience are defiled.

contents.verseText: They profess that they know God; but by their works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
contents: They profess that they know God; but by their works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good
work reprobate.

contents.verseText: But speak thou the things which befit the sound doctrine:
contents: But speak thou the things which befit the sound doctrine:

contents.verseText: that aged men be temperate, grave, sober-minded, sound in faith, in love, in patience:
contents: that aged men be temperate, grave, sober-minded, sound in faith, in love, in patience:

contents.verseText: that aged women likewise be reverent in demeanor, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good;
contents: that aged women likewise be reverent in demeanor, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is
good;

contents.verseText: that they may train the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,
contents: that they may train the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

contents.verseText: to be sober-minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed:
contents: sober-minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that the word of
God be not blasphemed:

contents.verseText: the younger men likewise exhort to be sober-minded:
contents: the younger men likewise exhort to be sober-minded:

contents.verseText: in all things showing thyself an ensample of good works; in thy doctrine showing uncorruptness, gravity,
contents: in all things showing thyself an ensample of good works; in thy doctrine
uncorruptness, gravity,

contents.verseText: sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of us.
contents: sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say
of us.

contents.verseText: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing to them in all things; not gainsaying;
contents: servants to be in subjection to their own masters,
to be well-pleasing
in all things; not gainsaying;

contents.verseText: not purloining, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.
contents: not purloining, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

contents.verseText: For the grace of God hath appeared, bringing salvation to all men,
contents: For the grace of God hath appeared, bringing salvation to all men,

contents.verseText: instructing us, to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly and righteously and godly in this present world;
contents: instructing us, to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly and righteously and
godly in this present world;

contents.verseText: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
contents: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

contents.verseText: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a people for his own possession, zealous of good works.
contents: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a people for his own
possession, zealous of good works.

contents.verseText: These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
contents: These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

contents.verseText: Put them in mind to be in subjection to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready unto every good work,
contents: Put them in mind to be in subjection to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready unto every good work,

contents.verseText: to speak evil of no man, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all meekness toward all men.
contents: to speak evil of no man, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all meekness toward all men.

contents.verseText: For we also once were foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, hating one another.
contents: For we also once were foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy,
hateful, hating one another.

contents.verseText: But when the kindness of God our Saviour, and his love toward man, appeared,
contents: But when the kindness of God our Saviour, and his love toward man, appeared,

contents.verseText: not by works done in righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy he saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,
contents: not by works
in righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy he saved us, through the
washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,

contents.verseText: which he poured out upon us richly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
contents: which he poured out upon us richly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

contents.verseText: that, being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
contents: that, being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

contents.verseText: Faithful is the saying, and concerning these things I desire that thou affirm confidently, to the end that they who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men:
contents: Faithful is the saying, and concerning these things I desire that thou affirm confidently, to the end that they who have
believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men:

contents.verseText: but shun foolish questionings, and genealogies, and strifes, and fightings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
contents: but shun foolish questionings, and genealogies, and strifes, and fightings about the law; for they are unprofitable and
vain.

contents.verseText: A factious man after a first and second admonition refuse;
contents: A factious man after a first and second admonition refuse;

contents.verseText: knowing that such a one is perverted, and sinneth, being self-condemned.
contents: knowing that such a one is perverted, and sinneth, being self-condemned.

contents.verseText: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, give diligence to come unto me to Nicopolis: for there I have determined to winter.
contents: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, give diligence to come unto me to Nicopolis: for there I have
determined to winter.

contents.verseText: Set forward Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
contents: Set forward Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

contents.verseText: And let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
contents: And let our
also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

contents.verseText: All that are with me salute thee. Salute them that love us in faith. Grace be with you all.
contents: All that are with me salute thee. Salute them that love us in faith.
Grace be with you all.
